enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-requisite: Students must have taken, be currently enrolled, or concurrently registered for RTVF 190 for the upcoming quarter.
title: SoC RTVF 373-0-20 Topics in Sound

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Situated between music and the visual arts, and employing technologies both new and old, sound art is a difficult to define field that is nonetheless steadily climbing into the public consciousness. This course will serve as an introduction to the concepts and techniques central to sound art practice today, through discussion of readings, technical topics, and examinations of several important artworks in the field. Students will complete a sound art work of their own as a final project.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Students will be evaluated based on their attendance and class participation, as well as a presentation, a short paper, 2-3 small projects, and a final project.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Students may need to reserve a small amount ($20-30) to spend on materials for a final project, depending on the shape their individual project takes.

subject: RTVF
